intro: Sphondylium austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture, while the stems are erect and often branched.
